    • Method Detail

      • exactEquals

        public static boolean exactEquals(double a,
                                  double b)
        Compares two double values, taking care of computing a relative error tolerance threshold.
        Parameters:
        a - first double
        b - second double
        Returns:
        true if the double are equals with a precision order of DOUBLE_EQUALITY_EPSILON

      • factDouble

        public static double factDouble(int n)
        This is a chached version of the factorial. It means it is slow for the first call, but extremely fast after that. It relies on the idea that normally inside Alchemist a factorial is called often with the same numbers (e.g. for the rate contribution computation of chemical reactions which involve more molecules of the same compound). Due to limited precision of double, you may experience precision loss with high numbers. This method returns meaningful results up to 170!. Over this limit, you get Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY.
        Parameters:
        n - the number to compute
        Returns:
        n!

      • factLong

        public static long factLong(int n)
        This is a chached version of the factorial. It means it is slow for the first call, but extremely fast after that. It relies on the idea that normally inside Alchemist a factorial is called often with the same numbers (e.g. for the rate contribution computation of chemical reactions which involve more molecules of the same compound). Due to limited length of long, this method works up to 20!.
        Parameters:
        n - the number to compute
        Returns:
        n!

      • firstOnePosition

        public static int firstOnePosition(long k)
        Given a long, this functions computes in which position the first zero appears, counting from the least significant bit.
        Parameters:
        k - the long number you wish to know where the first 1 occurs
        Returns:
        the first zero in a binary long number

      • forceRange

        public static double forceRange(double target,
                                double min,
                                double max)
        Parameters:
        target - the number
        min - the minimum
        max - the maximum
        Returns:
        min if target < min, max if target > max, target otherwise

      • fuzzyEquals

        public static boolean fuzzyEquals(double a,
                                  double b)
        Compares two double values, taking care of computing a relative error tolerance threshold.
        Parameters:
        a - first double
        b - second double
        Returns:
        true if the double are equals with a precision order of DOUBLE_EQUALITY_EPSILON

      • fuzzyGreaterEquals

        public static boolean fuzzyGreaterEquals(double a,
                                         double b)
        Compares two double values, taking care of computing a relative error tolerance threshold.
        Parameters:
        a - first double
        b - second double
        Returns:
        true if a > b, or if fuzzyEquals(a, b).

      • getEuclideanDistance

        public static <N extends Number> double getEuclideanDistance(double[] a,
                                                             double[] b)
        Just an application of Pythagore's theorem. If two arrays of different size are passed, the function throws an IllegalArgumentException.
        Type Parameters:
        N - the type of the coordinates
        Parameters:
        a - an array containing the coordinates of the first point
        b - an array containing the coordinates of the second point
        Returns:
        the euclidean distance between the two points.

      • isInEllipse

        public static boolean isInEllipse(double a2,
                                  double b2,
                                  double x,
                                  double y)
        Return whether a point is inside an ellipse or not.
        Parameters:
        a2 - Square of major axis
        b2 - Square of minor axis
        x - X position of the point to test
        y - Y position of the point to test
        Returns:
        true if the point is inside the ellipse

      • lanczosGamma

        public static double lanczosGamma(double xp)
        This method calculates the Gamma function Γ(x) using the Lanczos approximation.
        Parameters:
        xp - the variable for Γ(x)
        Returns:
        the Gamma function value with Lanczos approximation

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        log_2(v)

      • nearest

        public static double nearest(double val,
                             double v1,
                             double v2)
        Parameters:
        val - the value
        v1 - first value to compare to
        v2 - second value to compare to
        Returns:
        v1 if val is closer to v1 than to v2, v2 otherwise

      • nextDown

        public static double nextDown(double d)
        Equivalent of nextUp, but with opposite direction.
        Parameters:
        d - the double you want to get the previous value
        Returns:
        the double closest to the parameter in direction of negative infinity

      • randomInt

        Fast method to get a new random integer.
        Returns:
